author: sky.cactus
content:
I suspect there are two reasons:
1. It makes the chain useable more quickly by getting the newest stuff (most likely to be needed) first.
2. If you have a trusted block that you are starting your sync from, you can walk the header chain backwards as newer blocks point at older blocks but older blocks don't point at newer blocks.
